results.title: The Music box
results.creator_credit: Barbara Tilley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Tilley’s moving story starts with how she and her brother moved in with her older sister, Marge, to avoid being sent to a home. Ever since that moment, Marge has been the family rock, the one keeping everyone strong through the changes and sadness and keeping the family’s spirit alive.

results.title: Ingredients of love
results.creator_credit: Jenni Klempfner, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jenni Klempfner explores her ancestors’ Polish and Jewish heritage as well as her own multi-cultural family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.

results.title: Metamorphs: 1st year Swinburne Multimedia Design Project
results.brief_description:
A selection of animated morphs created by nine students in their first year Multimedia course, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology.
The students are: Alicia Braumberger, Andrew Coles, Matthew Robinson, Michael Yates, Oliver Pauliczek, Reif Campling, Richard Osellame, Steven Donnet and Yudy Chainy.
Includes a single split-screen edited trailer and a full version of each of the nine morphs created by the students.
results.description:

The students are: Alicia Braumberger, Andrew Coles, Matthew Robinson, Michael Yates, Oliver Pauliczek, Reif Campling, Richard Osellame, Steven Donnet and Yudy Chainy.

results.title: Journeys
results.creator_credit: Sheiny New, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sheiny New first came to Australia from America on a special scholarship program. While here she met her future husband and never looked back. She has since become a passionate campaigner speaking out against domestic violence in the Jewish community. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.

results.title: My beautiful shwesters
results.creator_credit: Adam Barolsky, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Adam Barolsky laments the distance he has put between himself and his sisters to find a better life. He tells a tale of deep sorrow and concern for the welfare of the family he has left behind. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adam Barolsky, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Park for all seasons
results.creator_credit: David Meagher and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Mossvale Park, nestled between Leongatha and Mirboo North in South Gippsland, is host to all types of community events from family barbeques to music festivals. Matt Dennis tells us why he is drawn to this “natural and beautiful place”.
results.description: Mossvale Park, nestled between Leongatha and Mirboo North in South Gippsland, is host to all types of community events from family barbeques to music festivals. Matt Dennis tells us why he is drawn to this “natural and beautiful place”.

results.title: The Man in the irony mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Andrew, Kath Shelper and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary portrays the life and death of performance artist and AIDS activist, Brenton Heath-Kerr. Through his repertoire of performances, costumes and photographs, Heath-Kerr challenged perceptions, dominant sterotypes and myths which he thought underpinned the gay communities and notions of gay identity. An emigre of drag and a gender misfit, Heath-Kerr understood that often holding a mask up to society had more political impact than holding up a mirror. (Source: Trove)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Andrew, Kath Shelper and Scarlett Pictures
results.description: This documentary portrays the life and death of performance artist and AIDS activist, Brenton Heath-Kerr. Through his repertoire of performances, costumes and photographs, Heath-Kerr challenged perceptions, dominant sterotypes and myths which he thought underpinned the gay communities and notions of gay identity. An emigre of drag and a gender misfit, Heath-Kerr understood that often holding a mask up to society had more political impact than holding up a mirror. (Source: Trove)
description_for_label: This documentary portrays the life and death of performance artist and AIDS activist, Brenton Heath-Kerr. Through his repertoire of performances, costumes and photographs, Heath-Kerr challenged perceptions, dominant sterotypes and myths which he thought underpinned the gay communities and notions of gay identity. An emigre of drag and a gender misfit, Heath-Kerr understood that often holding a mask up to society had more political impact than holding up a mirror. (Source: Trove)
